beliefs.text: AI should be developed with human well-being as the primary goal.
It is acceptable for AI to make life-or-death decisions without human oversight.
Governments should strictly regulate the development of advanced AI.
AI-driven job displacement is a necessary consequence of technological progress.
Personal data privacy is more important than the potential benefits of AI-driven services.

scenarios.title: Autonomous Vehicle Dilemma
scenarios.description: An autonomous vehicle is in an unavoidable accident. It must choose between hitting a group of pedestrians or swerving and hitting a single passenger in another car.

options.label: The AI should minimize loss of life, even if it means sacrificing its own passenger.
The AI should prioritize the safety of its passenger above all else.
A human should always make the final decision in such scenarios via remote control.

scenarios.title: AI in Hiring
scenarios.description: An AI is used to screen job applicants. It is more efficient but may perpetuate historical biases from its training data.

options.label: Use the AI for efficiency, but have human oversight to correct for bias.
Do not use the AI until it can be proven to be completely unbiased.
Use the AI without oversight; efficiency gains are worth the risk of some bias.
